author: wtopstaff
title: Eastern Michigan-Toledo Preview Capsule
text:
By The Associated Press  21 pm 
Eastern Michigan (1-5, 0-2 MAC) at No. 22 Toledo (5-0, 2-0), noon (ESPN3) 
Line: Toledo by 28 1-2. 
Series Record: Toledo leads 31-11. 
WHAT’S AT STAKE 
Toledo is looking to stay atop the Mid-American Conference West Division standings and start 6-0 for the first time since 1997. Eastern Michigan is looking for its second victory, which would match its season total for each of the past three years. 
KEY MATCHUP 
Eastern Michigan QB Brogan Roback vs. Toledo’s secondary. With the strong Rockets’ rushing defense, ranked No. 7 in the nation, focused on stopping the MAC’s second-leading rusher in EMU’s Darius Jackson, the Toledo St. John’s Jesuit product may need to move the ball through the air to keep the Eagles in the game. 
PLAYERS TO WATCH 
Toledo: RBs Kareem Hunt, Terry Swanson and Damion Jones-Moore. Each has had big games this season while the others rotated in and out of the lineup because of suspension and injuries. They will be facing an EMU defense that allows a nation-worst 360.3 rushing yards per game. Idaho (317.8) is the only other team in the country allowing more than 300 yards per game. 
Eastern Michigan: TB Jackson is the second-leading rusher in the MAC and linebacker Great Ibe leads the conference with 11.8 tackles per game. 
FACTS & FIGURES 
Toledo and Air Force are the only two teams in the country that have not allowed a sack this season. The Rockets have passed the ball 173 times, compared to just 49 for Air Force. . Toledo has won the last eight meetings with Eastern Michigan by an average score of 49.4-21 and has scored at least 41 points in each of those victories. . Toledo’s No. 22 ranking is its highest since the Rockets were No. 18 on November 3, 1997. Topics:
